newsitem.title: CANADA: CWB details Prairie elevator space, railcar unload.
newsitem.headline: CWB details Prairie elevator space, railcar unload.

text.p: Vacant space in Canadian Prairie primary elevators increased to 35 percent in the week ended June 2 while railcar unloads exceeded targets, the Canadian Wheat Board said.
The average vacancy in Prairie elevators was 35 percent, up from 32 percent on May 25, it said.
Manitoba showed the most space available at 42 percent followed by Alberta at 34 percent and Saskatchewan at 33 percent.
Vancouver unloaded 3,103 railcars versus the 3,300 target. Prince Rupert unloaded 1,373 railcars versus the 1,300 target.
Thunder Bay unloaded 3,815 railcars versus the 3,075 hopper car target.
